context.p: You can insert a reference to an external entity which is declared in the current document.

step.cmd: Place the cursor in the position for insertion.

info.p: Place the cursor in the Editing Window or in the ContentMap in the position where you want to insert the external entity reference.

step.cmd: Call up the Insert External Entity Dialog.

info.p: To call up the Insert External Entity Dialog, do one of the following:

stepresult.p: The Insert External Entity Dialog will appear. It shows external entities declared in the document and allows you to browse for a file to declare a new entity and insert the entity reference.

substep.cmd: Select the Declared Entities radio button.
Select a declared external entity from the list.

fig.title: Declared external entity selected for insertion.

info.p: To insert the reference to the selected external entity, click OK.

stepresult.p: The external entity reference will be inserted in the document.

fig.title: External entity reference inserted in the document.

stepresult.p: You can also convert the document portion from the external entity into a regular content, change the external entity declaration or remove the external entity declaration.
